title: 105_hr2930
content: The Act titled "Iran Missile Proliferation Sanctions Act of 1997" requires reports on missile proliferation to Iran. The President must submit reports to specific committees identifying foreign persons involved in transferring items contributing to Iran's ballistic missile efforts. The President must submit reports to specific committees identifying foreign persons involved in transferring items contributing to Iran's ballistic missile efforts. Reports must be submitted within specific timeframes after the enactment of the Act. Exceptions apply to foreign persons previously identified in reports. Foreign persons previously identified in reports are not required to be identified again in subsequent reports if they have engaged in certain transfers or transactions related to sanctions or waivers. Reports submitted under subsection (a) may be submitted in classified form when deemed appropriate by the President. SEC. 3. IMPOSITION OF SANCTIONS. Requirement To Impose Sanctions on foreign persons identified in reports under section 2, effective 30 days after the report triggering the sanction is submitted. Sanctions are imposed on foreign persons identified in reports under section 2, effective 30 days after the report triggering the sanction is submitted. The sanctions include an arms export sanction for a minimum of 2 years, prohibiting the sale of items on the United States Munitions List to the sanctioned person. Sanctions are imposed on foreign persons identified in reports under section 2, effective 30 days after the report triggering the sanction is submitted. This includes prohibiting the sale of items on the United States Munitions List to the sanctioned person, as well as imposing dual-use sanctions and restricting United States assistance for a minimum of 2 years. SEC. 4. WAIVER ON BASIS OF ADDITIONAL INFORMATION. The President may waive sanctions on a foreign person if convinced they did not contribute to Iran's ballistic missile efforts after August 8, 1995. The President can waive sanctions on a foreign person if they did not contribute to Iran's ballistic missile efforts after August 8, 1995. The determination and report must include a written justification detailing the transfer of items or technical assistance related to ballistic missiles. The President can waive sanctions on a foreign person if they did not transfer items or provide technical assistance related to ballistic missiles. The determination and report must include additional information that persuaded the President, analysis supporting the conclusion, and may be submitted in classified form. The determination and report of the President under subsection (a) and the written justification under subsection (b) may be submitted in classified form if appropriate. The President can waive sanctions under section 3 for a foreign person if deemed essential for national security. The waiver must be reported to the relevant committees with a detailed written justification, which may be submitted in classified form if necessary. SEC. 6. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION REGARDING ACTIONS BY GOVERNMENT OF PRIMARY JURISDICTION. The President must include information in each report about foreign persons, including whether the government of primary jurisdiction was aware of their activities. If not, reasons for not informing that government should be explained. If the government was aware, efforts made should be described. The report must include a description of efforts made by the government to prevent activities of foreign persons, an assessment of the effectiveness of those efforts, and any sanctions imposed by the United States Government for failure to prevent such activities. SEC. 7. PURCHASE OF WEAPONS TECHNOLOGY. The Congress urges the President to use authority to prevent weapons-related material transfer to Iran and the transfer of scientific expertise. Funds from the Foreign Assistance Act may be used for this purpose. SEC. 8. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines "foreign person" as a natural person that is an alien, a foreign entity, or a foreign governmental entity operating as a business enterprise. It also defines "government of primary jurisdiction" as the foreign government of a natural person's citizenship. The term "MTCR Annex" is defined in the Export Administration Act of 1979 as related to foreign governmental entities and their respective foreign governments.
